styles.name: Sparkling Wine
styles.description: Carbonated by yeast fermenting in an airtight container. Two main methods: traditional method and tank method.

styles.name: Light-Bodied White Wine
styles.description: Known for dry and refreshingly tart flavor. Best enjoyed young when they have maximum acidity and bold fruit.

styles.name: Full-Bodied White Wine
styles.description: Known for rich, bold flavors. Often aged on lees or in oak barrels to add unctuous flavors of cream, vanilla, and butter.

styles.name: Aromatic White Wine
styles.description: Highly perfumed with sweet-fruit aromas but can range from dry to sweet. Ideal pairing partners with Asian and Indian cuisine.

styles.name: Rosé Wine
styles.description: Produced when red grape skins macerate in their juices briefly. Ranges from dry to sweet depending on the grape.

styles.name: Light-Bodied Red Wine
styles.description: Translucent in color with moderately high acidity. Known for perfumed aromas best collected in a large globe-shaped glass.

styles.name: Medium-Bodied Red Wine
styles.description: Often called 'food wines' for their excellent ability to pair with a wide range of food. Characterized by dominant red-fruit flavors.
